intro: Sida bipartita, commonly known as the two-parted sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as fields and along stream banks. Sida bipartita is often used in traditional medicine and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
